#Text=Gour-Pandua
#Text=Gour-Pandua is a historical city in Malda district of West Bengal
#Text=Understand
#Text=Gaud or Gour is in Bangladesh .
#Text=Gour-Pandua is the medieval capital of Bengal .
#Text=They are twin towns located to the north and south of Malda town , 340 km from Kolkata , in West Bengal .
#Text=Malda is the base for a visit to Gour-Pandua .
#Text=The area saw three eras of glory - the Buddhist Palas , the Hindu Senas and the Muslim Sultans .
#Text=The Senas , the last Hindu kings of Bengal , were displaced by the Muslims in the beginning of the 13th century .
#Text=They ruled till the Battle of Palashi in 1757 .
#Text=There is no trace of any shrine or structure of the Buddhist or Hindu periods .
#Text=Even those of the Muslim period are virtually in ruin .
#Text=During the 13th-14th century Bengal 's rulers maintained a certain independence from the Sultans in Delhi .
#Text=It was also the period of founding of the Bengali language and the Bengali identity .
#Text=The Iliyas Shah dynasty ruling from Gour played a big role in that development .
#Text=The place has variously been referred to as Lakshanabati , Lakhnauti and Jannatabad .
#Text=By train
#Text=It is about 7-8 hours from Kolkata .
#Text=All trains going to North Bengal stop at Malda Town .
#Text=Convenient connections from Kolkata –
#Text=Gour Express from Sealdah , Intercity Express from Howrah etc.
#Text=By bus
#Text=Rocket service from Esplanade , Kolkata for Siliguri .
#Text=By car

#Text=The normal route is to take NH 12 , which links Dalkolha with Kolkata , but the longer route via Durgapur Expressway ( part of NH 19 ) from Dankuni , NH 19 from Palsit to Panagarh bypassing Bardhaman city , and then taking the Panagarh-Moregarm Expressway up to Morgram and on to NH 12 is a more comfortable and enjoyable option .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Hired cars are available at Malda Town and Sujapur ( local town situated on NH_34 )
#Text=West Bengal Tourism operates a bus from Malda for visiting Gour and Pandua .
#Text=For details check with Tourist Lodge at Malda .
#Text=Area landmarks
#Text=Malda Town railway station .
#Text=Mohodipur border crossing ( India-Bangladesh border ) .
#Text=Mahananda Bridge .
#Text=NBSTC Malda Depot .
#Text=At Gour
#Text=Situated 14 km south of Malda
#Text=Ramkeli .
#Text=Contains footprints of Sri Chaitanya on stone .
#Text=Baro Sona Masjid ( Half a kilometre from Ramkeli ) .
#Text=It is also called Baro Duari Masjid .
#Text=It was , started by Allaudin Shah and completed by his son , Nasiruddin Nusrat Shah in 1526 .
#Text=The Indo-Arabic style of architecture and the ornamental stone carvings make Baroduari a special attraction for tourists .
#Text=The 168 ft x 76 ft structure is said to have 44 gilded domes , of which only 11 exist , that too without the gold cover .
#Text=Dakhil Darwaza .
#Text=Built in 1425 and also known as Salami Darwaza it was once the main entry for the fort .
#Text=It is more than 21 metres high and 34.5 metres wide .
#Text=Firoz Minar ( A kilometre away from Dakhil Darwaja ) .
#Text=It was built by Sultan Saifuddin Feroze Shah during 1485-89 to mark his triumph over Barbak Shah . 26 metres high and 19 metres in circumference .
#Text=Tourists are not allowed to climb .
#Text=Chika Masjid ( near Kadam Rasul Masjid ) .
#Text=Sultan Yusuf Shah built the Chika Mosque in 1475 .
#Text=The beautifully ornate carvings on the walls and the images of Hindu idols on the stonework of doors and lintels are still partly visible .
#Text=Near Chika masjid is a mango orchard and beyond it the Bais Gazi wall , built in 1460 by Barbak Shah to protect his palace .
#Text=The palace has vanished but some parts of the wall remain .
#Text=Near the wall are excavations made in 2003 .
#Text=Kadam Rasul Masjid ( Half a kilometre from the Feroze Minar . ) .
#Text=This mosque was built by Sultan Nasiruddin Nusrat Shah in 1530 .
#Text=It contains the footprints of the Prophet , Hazrat Muhammad on stone .
#Text=It was brought from Arabia by Pir Shah Jalal Tabriji .
#Text=Tomb of Fateh Khan ( Opposite the Kadam Rasul Mosque ) .
#Text=This 17th century tomb of a commander of Aurangzeb 's army is an interesting structure , built in the Hindu chala style .
#Text=Tantipara Masjid .
#Text=It has intricate terracotta work .
#Text=Lukochuri Darwaja ( Located to the south-east of the Kadam Rasul Mosque . ) .
#Text=This is a place where the sultans played hide and seek with the begums .
#Text=There is a difference of opinion as to who built this gate , some say that Shah Shuja built it in 1655 , others opine that it was built by Allauddin Hussein Shah in 1522 .
#Text=The innovative architectural style makes it an interesting place to visit .
#Text=Chamkati Masjid ( near Kadam Rasul Masjid ) .
#Text=Gumti Darwaza ( near Kadam Rasul Masjid ) .
#Text=This small decorated structure with a dome , near the Lukochuri Darwaja , probably served as a private entrance from the eastern side .
#Text=Lotan Masjid .

#Text=There are some monuments on the Bangladesh side of the border and are approachable from Bangladesh : Chhoto Sona Masjid , Khania Dighi Masjid , Balia Dighi , Darasbari Masjid , Dunichak Masjid and Firozpur Masjid .
#Text=See Gaud for details .
#Text=At Pandua
#Text=Situated 15 km north of Malda town .
#Text=Adina Masjid .
#Text=Built in 1369 by Sultan Sikander Shah it was one of the largest mosques in India .
#Text=Carved basalt masonry from earlier Hindu temples is said to have also been used .
#Text=Qutb Shahi Masjid .
#Text=Locally known as the Chhoto Sona Masjid , built to honour Saint Nur Qutb-ul-Alam .
#Text=The ruins of his shrine are nearby , along with that of Saint Hazrat Shah Jalal Tabrizi , collectively known as the Bari Darga .
#Text=Eklakhi Mausoleum .
#Text=It is the most elegant monument in Pandua , with a carved Ganesh on the doorway .
#Text=It is a tomb of the son of a Hindu Raja , who converted to Islam .
#Text=Do
#Text=Relax in your place of stay - the visit to the historical sites will be tiring .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Malda is famous for mango , it is called " mango city " .
#Text=Otherwise , there is nothing special about Malda but those who are very keen to buy something can look for Murshidabad silk .
#Text=Those who are traveling by car can look for fresh vegetables , particularly extra-large aubergines .
#Text=Eat
#Text=There are no eateries in Gour or Pandua .
#Text=In Malda , there are some good sweet-meat shops with local varieties .
#Text=Some eateries in Malda are : Rajani Ganhdha ( Continental Lodge ) , Purbanchal , Fiza ( Kalinga Hotel ) , Rojgere Ginni ( Chanakya Hotel ) , Payel restaurant .
